title: Amid COVID surge, Rajasthan prisoners refrained from meeting kin till April 19
description: Jaipur (Rajasthan) [India], April 6 (ANI): Amid a surge in the COVID-19 cases in the state, prisoners in jails across Rajasthan have been refrained from meeting their families in person till April 19 but will continue to stay in touch with them through monitored phone call and video conferencing.

title: COVID update: From Delhi to Rajasthan, states which have imposed night curfew amid rising cases | Latest News & Updates at DNAIndia.com
description: COVID update: From Delhi to Rajasthan, states which have imposed night curfew amid rising cases - Delhi is the latest state to impose night curfew in the country. List of other states which have imposed night curfew amid rising COVID-19 cases.

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, and Delhi increase national COVID tally - Maharashtra adds the numbers
description: According to a report by ANI, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, and Delhi accounted for a large number of new COVID-19 cases reported in a span of 24 hours in the country. Maharashtra has reported 47,288 new COVID-19 cases and 155 deaths in the last 24 hours. At present, the case fatality rate in the state stands at 1.83 per cent. Out of the 2,07,15,793 laboratory samples, which were taken until today, 30,57,885 (14.76 per cent) have tested positive for Covid-19. The state presently has 4,51,375 active cases. With the new deaths in the last 24 hours, the COVID-19 death toll mounts to 56,033 in Maharashtra. Maharashtra adds the numbers

title: 180 Covid-19 vaccination centers set up in Jaipur for all above 45 years
description: Jaipur: Those above 45 years were administered Covid-19 vaccination across the state on Thursday. The medical and health department has set up over 300 vaccination centres in Jaipur district. Of them, 180 are in Jaipur city. The vaccination drive at government hospitals, primary health centres and other medical facilities started at 9 am on Thursday. […]
